content: I really enjoy it more than handspeak. I know there are different takes on asl signs, but I think this is more accurate. However I ended up using PSE (pidgen signed english) rather asl which are two different signing abilities. Could you try putting in ASL sentence structure? I'm sure if you make an app based around asl sentence structure too maybe it will help others better understand asl rather pse
Wonderfully clear
Great platform easy to learn from

I am new beginner. Love the app But have to look up every single word. So when you hit the X to back out a word you still have to hit that box again for the keyboard to pop up. The angle of which is hands show is so straightforward that I have to replay slow motion alot to see what her side of her hands are doing. If camera angle was from higher I think that would help a bunch. Would be 5 stars if not for those 2 things.
replyContent: You can swipe the video screen to get the next or previous video without going back to the word list. Also when on the word list, on the right side you can use the a-z to scroll quickly through the word list, or push up on the word list to scroll slowly. Or if looking for a specific word use the search feature. Thank you were glad you like the app.

content: Great learning tool
replyContent: Thank you. We love knowing people are using and like the app.

content: Purchase first with iPhone, then again with Android when switched phones. I asked and was told I had to purchase again. Unfortunately, all the better updates are on the iPhone none on Android . No option to cover mouth during quize, can't rearrange favorites in order and freezes often. I also read there are improved test too. Five star on iPhone not on Android. I wish I didn't know what I was missing. I paid twice thinking the app was the same. Disappointing!
replyContent: Please understand that Android apps and iPhone Apps are sold by two different companies Google and Apple, and run on two different operating systems Android and iOS. We too had to make two completely separate apps. We work hard and tried our best to make them identical but there are some limitations and we're not perfect. Thank you for your support

content: Great app, video is helpful and good offline
replyContent: Thank you, we're glad you like the app.

content: The signer mouthing the vocabulary isn't helpful
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. We tried to make the app good for everyone. We worked hard on making all the videos and features and hope it is still helping you learn and communicate.

content: Asome
replyContent: Thank you. We're glad you are using and enjoying the app.

content: Meh, the quizzes are nice but my main issue is basic clothing to help describe people are not on here Which is one of the first things in ASL 1. And they signed "pants" instead of "jeans" like they have listed.... It is fairly helpful for studying in general though
replyContent: Thank you, were glad you are using and enjoying the app. We are always looking to add new videos and features.

content: Wonderful so far.
replyContent: Thank you. Enjoy the app.

content: Very fluid operation, accurate signs. I have an intermediate ASL fluency, and the signs are accurate to the modern signs I've learned so far. Super easy and smooth app! A+++!
replyContent: Thank you, we worked hard on the app and love knowing people are using and love the app.

content: My hearing has always been a little off. My hearing is at about 60%-80% of what it should be. I have to watch people's mouths along with listening in order to understand what they are saying. About 90% of the time, if I can't see your mouth, I can't understand you. I bought this app at a moment my hearing was at about 30%-50%. I am greatly appreciating the help this app is giving with my lip reading skills. I may need them one day. It will be good to be fluent in lip reading along with the ASL.
replyContent: Thank you for sharing, we worked hard on making the app and love knowing people are using it and its improving peoples lives. Enjoy the app.

content: Excelente
replyContent: Thank you.

content: Excellent resource!
replyContent: Thank you.

content: Doesn't work
replyContent: Yes it works fine. Please update to the latest version of the app and do a full restart of your phone. There are no issues with this app. if you need help please email us at, appsavers@gmail.com Thank you.

content: It is extremely useful and I have increased my sign language knowledge in just a few short months by taking the quizzes and utilizing the practice exercises.
replyContent: Thank you, we're glad you like the app. We are working on more quiz features.

content: It's great having an extensive, clear dictionary like this at my fingertips. I consult it all the time. One thing I struggle with is differentiating signs that have similar motions, like SAY and TRUE or WHEN and ABOUT (those are simple ones but it happens to me with a lot of new signs). I'd love it if you added a feature to flip back and forth between two signs so the user can directly compare them!
replyContent: Thank you, we worked hard on making a lot of features. You can swipe the video screen between next and previous video but we like your idea of swiping between two selected videos. We will try and work on that in one of our next updates. soon.

content: I enjoy this app it comes in handy at times
replyContent: Thank you.

content: great app
replyContent: Thank you

content: best one so far
replyContent: Thank you

content: can you make a setting where I can write notes that help me remember each one. something that shows up like a caption banner. there are a lot of signs that I have a "and that's how I'll remember this one" thought, but there's more I'd like to write down on some words. that way when I'm drilling my favorite word vocabulary, I have notes that show up without giving me the answer
replyContent: Great idea. Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback. Were glad you like the app and will try to work on it in one of our next updates.

content: A great app. Quite accurate. TW - there's at least one "Easter egg" in it. Look up the word "pug". It's funny!
replyContent: Thank you

content: Love it! ...even though "lizard" is missing (my toddler asked for that word of all things). Well you can't have everything — you can't even have "lizard" in your ASL app. Anyhow: Well worth the price! I just wish the app had an option to loop through a practice list!...and the word "lizard."
replyContent: Thank you. You can add words to the favorites list and then use the Play All feature to play through the list of words you created.

content: this app is pretty good, but is there any way you guys could add a way to make it play through a randomly sorted list of all of the words? Or to be able to mark words as resolved/learned so they don't show up in the random list? Or to have a word of the day?
replyContent: Great idea. We do have a Play All feature that will play through either a category of words or your favorites list or even all 5000 videos, but we like your idea of randomly selecting words to play through and we will work on that in one of our next updates. Thanks again for your ideas and feedback.

content: I love the app and find it extremely useful however I feel it can be improved by adding a category for the states and a how to say category. Simple things like how are you. what's your name things of that nature. Overall I am impressed with the app and how it functions...
replyContent: Thank you. We are always trying to improve the app with new features and will try to work on that in one of our next updates. Thank you again for your ideas and feedback.

content: This is a wonderful learning tool.
replyContent: Thank you

content: Very well done! Proffessional quality, easy to use, well worth the price. Now, please make an ASL phrase dictionary for us hearing people who are grammatically impaired. : )
replyContent: Thank you, we love knowing people are using and enjoying the app. Great idea, we will work on it. Thanks again.

content: Great quality videos, with tons of words to choose from. Easy to search for specific words. Some times I tap on play all and just watch one sign after another. There is even a quiz section. I usually cover the signers face because I don't want to be able to read her lips. Nice feature to download videos for offline use. I do however wish there was a way to move videos to external sd card. Make sure you look up the sign for pug!
replyContent: Thank you, we worked hard on making all these features and we're glad you are using and enjoying the app.

content: I love it. After downloading the videos i feel like I have full access! I am learning ASL at school and this app is nice for all the little words that cant be covered in class.
replyContent: Thank you. Yes downloading all the videos makes it great for off line use. Were glad you are using and enjoying the app.

content: Never seen some of these words. I like the quiz portion but more if it would quiz me on my favs that I actually picked. would be even better if she didnt say anything during the videos. I have to cover her face and concentrate on the signs. other than that this is a pretty great app.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. We tried to make the app good for everyone. Were glad you like the quiz, we are also working on new quiz features.

content: I am learning ASL and LOVE the quiz feature to learn new words, review and practice!!! Thank you!!!
replyContent: Thank you, we love knowing you are using and love the app. We are working on new quiz features.

content: great reference app if you are learning ASL
replyContent: Thank you

content: Phenomenal. I'm learning ASL and this is hugely helpful. Great examples, the quiz works super well. This is what I've been looking for.

I highly recommend this app! I am an interpreting student and I use this app everyday! I have quite a few I utilize, signing savvy, asldeafined, the asl app (Deaf model from Americas next top model) and sign school. this app is very straightforward and I have not experienced any technical issues. I have the ability to use offline as well which is so helpful. it also has the feature of playing all the signs from A-Z and I use this feature daily!
replyContent: Thank you, we love knowing people are using and love the app, yes the PLAY ALL feature is pretty nice, I use it too so that I can just watch without needing to do anything. Thanks again for your feedback. Enjoy the app.

content: Its a great app. But it wont allow me to add Blue and Grey to my favorites.
great! thanks for getting all these words together! you definetly are doing the due diligence to break comunication barriers! blessings

The Best ASL Dictionary App here! I'm looking forward to having more words/signs added in the future. Software Studios, do you have plans on making a kid version of this with large colorful illustrations just so kids who are hard of hearing can easily know what the sign is for? I bought this app so I could teach my niece but It'd be better if she could access it just as easily - with the help of real and/or cartoon images. Having a flashcard feature would be neat and I'd gladly buy it!
Good so good
Videos are not downloading I've been removing and putting it back but no success. I want my money back
replyContent: Pleas update to the latest version of the app. You can reach us at Appsavers@gmail.com for help. Thank you

content: Has been the most helpful ASL app I've had. The only one I've kept.
I absolutely love it! My best friend is Deaf and she told me to get this app.
Great ASL app. Had it for a month so far and haven't experienced any issues.

This ap is so much better than a paper dictionary. You can see a clean 
rendition of the sign. I like the loop and slow motion feature. I can place 
a word on a loop and practice it by copying the motions. It would be great 
if they could add phrases and idioms.

Very helpful app. The quiz feature is a great idea, but not very helpful 
for learning since most of the signs are being mouthed at the same time.
This app is nice
Amazing!
It's great for learning words. It shows the actions well so you can learn quickly.
Pretty good waiting for the update to be released

Not too bad at the moment.  For the finger-spelling quizzes, I'd rather having the option for manually typing the answer than choosing from multiple answers; makes it too easy to guess by just looking at the first and last letter signed. It'd also be great if there's simple phrases included in the dictionary.
This App is awesome, Tech support is just as awesome, especially if your not a cell phone savy operator. Lol. Great Job and thanks for getting me up and learning.
Great App. Videos are high quality and it works very smoothly. Use it all the time.

This is the best digital ASL dictionary I've ever used. There are a ton of words, all in HD video. I like that I can create a list to review words that I'm learning. I emailed tech support with a suggestion and they got back to me right away and were receptive to the feedback. Awesome app!
Loving it
Almost perfect! Great app. I'd give five stars if it also offered option for sd card storage.
Very helpful. I love it! Simple to use.
I love this APP, use it all the time and recommend it to others.
Can you add "credit" as in credit you get for taking a college class?
I really like this dictionary. It has lots but not all. And the sign for of is amazing.
ASL Sign Language
Difficult to load. Check what you r suggesting a "non-professional" computer/cellphone user should TRY doing. Not in an average persons lifetime. Takes it back to the drawing board.
replyContent: We're happy to help you download the app. It is very easy to use. Please email us and we will help you. We can also call you and help you over the phone. We worked hard on this app and one star makes us sad. Our email is appsavers@gmail.com

content: My goto app when I need to check what a sign is or just to refresh my memory. Still needs the option to move data to external SDCard, 400+ mb is a lot of space to take up on a phone, also might solve the issue my wife and I continue to have of losing the videos if the internal storage space we have free drops to 500mb or less. Also being able to move the videos to external SD storage would allow more features like phrases to be added without concern for space.
Easy to use and keeps my skills up
Good good app- I like

I liked the app so much there's a lot to choose from simple words to food excersises and everything well almost everything what I would like and it would help a lot between just learning to really communicating with phrases questions how to ask them that way people will really get comfortable with asking and answering questions another thing you guys should really think of how people really learn new stuff for example :some people learn visually others by hearing very few learn by both but it would help.
I really like this app especially the options of continual play and having your favorites category. Is there away you can make it where you can create your own categories?

Love the app but please find another way to store videos rather than cached files.  My "cleaner" recognizes them as junk and I can't clean my phone easily without deleting your files.  Thanks for help!
Awesome app
Some features could be faster but a great resource to learn asl
Asl  app

I only wish that for words with more than one sign a definition would be provided. So we know when it's appropriate to use each specific sign. For example "about". Has a meaning to say "When I purchased that item it cost about $100." Or "What was that story about?".
Had videos downloaded but for some reason it is still needing to download videos for some reason and on downloading I continually get a download error
replyContent: Hi please try to do several full restarts of your device by holding down the power button until you can power off. Then download the videos again. For additional help please email us at appsavers@gmail.com

content: Trying to download the videos keeps saying app closed. Didn't pay 6.99 for an app I can't use
replyContent: Please update to the latest version of the app. IWe guarantee our app to work. We tried to email you. Please respond to our tech support so we can help you. Thank you.

content: Just installed, may return it. The quiz is ridiculous, because the signer mouths the words and you can totally read what she's saying. What is the point of THAT?

I find myself constantly going back to the free 'sign ASL' app because this one is missing a LOT of words & sometimes the signs are older/wrong/have changed. Other app includes several choices and descriptions for context to avoid humiliation! I regret paying for this. Study option was cool BUT the woman MOUTHS the words= Pointless!! Only plus is option to download all videos, so youd better have an extra memory card space on your phone. Plz fix!
Love the app even though it's missing a few words that I'm trying to learn for my deaf toddler like "stand up", but other than that it's great. Tech support is extremely helpful and quick to respond!

Its a great app, but lately when using the Quiz option, it'll only go for about 5 videos and then it stops. The video stays on the same one but the options are available to choose which sign it is. The answers change but the video does not. And then the screen goes black. Please fix this.
I refer to this app quite often when I need help remembering or learning  a word.

Better than the previous one. However, I would still like to have recent updates. Maybe add 'word of the day' or something like that. Found that the sign for "steel" is wrong on the app, the video that shows the sign for "glass" is used. In addition, I would like to see a new category for ASL idioms.
replyContent: Thank you for your suggestions and finding the steel video. This video got mixed up, we will fix it the next time we update the app.

content: I'm getting more and more into ASL and this is the perfect app! I think I also have a crush on the lady in the videos...

This is an awesome app. I've already learned quite a bit. The only complaint I would have is they need to have a common phrases category. And things like the Pledge of Allegiance, Girl Scout and Boy Scout mottos and laws, and the national anthem category.

Works really well.  Reason I rated it low.  For a dictionary it doesn't have very many signs.   Frustrating when I can't find the sign here and have to look it up on other apps..  Developer said he would add the signs that I can't find as long as I let him know.  That is awesome!!!!  Will give it a try:)  Thank you!
replyContent:
If you feel a sign is missing please let us know, our team will research it and add it the next time we film. Thank you.

Thank you, a lot of our features were suggested by our users, we love knowing you like and are using the app and how we can make it better.

content: I have used this app for quite a while now, and it has most of the signs I need (but not all). Now I see there is ANOTHER app by the same company, but THAT app has phrases and idioms! Why not just add those to this app? Am I supposed to give you more money and install a new app when I already paid for this one? Disappointing.
replyContent:
Each dictionary has different features, one important one is file size, therefore they cant be combined. This HD version is our latest app, however many people also love our original ASL Dictionary.

If you notice a sign missing please let us know through the contact us button in the app. Keep in mind not all English words have ASL Signs. Thanks

content: What a helpful app! The dictionary is extremely inclusive, and the quiz function is extremely helpful when it comes to helping me learn my ASL vocabulary. Easily worth the cost!
Very helpful for new Signers.  Definitely a must for receptive and signs.  A little different than class  (more than one sign).
I love it but it would help if the lady was not mouth limping the words in the quizzes.
Its pretty cool and im learning but.... Quiz would be more challenging if the lady wouldnt mouth the word while she sign it

You WONDERFUL, God sent creators, of this APP, have NO IDEA, what you've done! Of the Blessing that you are! @ 22 I had sudden onset hearing loss. Husband couldn't cope. I was now a single mom of two HEARING babies.. I now 'hear' out of 1ear only, & that's thru a Cochlear implant, W/ lip reading too. Anyhow, your teaching me how to be able to communicate with my kids & on a whole new deeper level at that! I live in 1 of the largest cities in the USA!! & We have NADA here that even comes close to your APP!!
I always wanted to say "i want a hippopotamus for Christmas"
It's a great reference
It would be great if you added more words to the dictionary, I would like to use this app to help with my ASL class
replyContent: We try to have every accepted ASL sign, if you feel a word is missing please email it to us at appsavers@gmail.com and we may add it the next time we film. Also note there is not an ASL sign for every English word. English has over 1 million words and ASL is only about 5000 signs. We hope you are enjoying the app otherwise. Thank you.

content: You told me you would change it so that it no longer stops my music a few weeks ago but it still does. 😭😭😭😭😭😭😭😭😭😭😩
replyContent: Hi Kylie, Normally video has sound and phones don't allow users to play two videos or two audio streams at the same time. We did find a solution and currently the app will play video with your music. However HTC and Samsung have a built in block. We will continue to try and find a way to make this possible for you but it may be beyond our control.

content: Going to school to be an interpreter. This is a great pocket reference for me that seems a lot of time. The only thing I don't like is that she mouth all the words. I hope that more signs are added in time. Happily pay extra.
Whoever created this deserves alot more money.
I love this app! Defiantly vorite asl tool that I have!
This is a great app that is easy to learn from!
Love this app! it makes learning sighnlanguage verry easy
I love this App , I also have the other dictionary that is available from  software studios. Both are great..I have one for my HTC and the other loaded on my tablet. GREAT job
Great app.  I'm a current asl student and I find this to be very useful!
Great app! I would give it 5 stars if one was able generate a favorites list on one device and then copy to another device, such as from phone to tablet.
replyContent: Great idea Jerry. Thanks we will work on it.

content: I have an eight year old grandson who is deaf. This app has been valuable beyond my ability to express. Using this tool, I have expanded my ASL vocabulary greatly. This has helped my grandson not feel so isolated,  which has, in turn, helped his behavior. This may well be the most useful app I have gotten to date!
Connected to wifi and downloaded all vids with no problems. Great video dictionary for a quick word look up. Fast responce from support team regarding Q's and sugestions.
As an ASL interpretation student, this app is fantastic.
It would be nice if the app would work over 4g, either with a warning about data usage or with low resolution videos.

I really like this app. Was a but turned off since the app didn't seems to have an offline version, I just have to figure out how to set that option. "abdomen" is spelled wrong in the words list and there aren't enough locations listed. I feel that should be a category. I hope they continue to build this app because it's a great tool.
replyContent: Yes, you can use the app offline... Click the tools button at the bottom of the screen, then press "Download All" to install all the videos. We are continually updating the app. Thanks for your support.

content: Really love this app
Easy to use!

This app is great,  I like the downloadable video feature, so that you don't have to be connected to wifi. Downloaded this app for my ASL1 course and I know others who enjoy the app just as much.  It's worth the money you pay for it.  I wouldn't use any other app. Works on both my Samsung Galaxy4 phone and my Galaxy tablet.

I LOVE this app!  With wifi you can download the entire 5000 word dictionary of vids & view offline anytime!  I did have an issue of not letting me view the vids without wifi after downloading. But, the devs are awesome! Quick to reply and work with you to resolve any problem. Re-installed and it works fine now!  Totally worth the $$!  Only suggestions I have are to add the idioms & phrases that are available in the first app, and update the fingerspelling quizzes to work on receptive skills. Awesome app!!
replyContent: Our pleasure, thank you so much for your support! Your reviews really mean a lot to us.

content: I have screwed with this app for two days. The inability to allow the user to choose to update over the air to be a huge inconvenience for someone who has to travel to use WiFi. Then when I locate a WiFi connection the app refuses to download for offline use. Uninstalled and reinstalled problem persists freezes up will continue to try to make it work, until then I remain disgusted.
replyContent: We are easy to contact & always here to help you. Please contact tech support before leaving a bad review. There may be several reasons why you are having an issue. The app works fine, you do not need to use WiFi. Tech support email is  appsavers@gmail.com For starters please try doing a full restart of your device. Then try downloading all videos.

content: I got this as a better standalone app to its older sister, but before I could watch the videos I had to be on wifi. Okay, so I opted to download all the videos and make it available for on the go. Only, after taking over 1 hour of downloading the "full" video library it still says it has to be connected to wifi for some videos. Fix this and 5 stars. Evo 4g lte. EDIT: Dev helped me fix this issue. Just uninstall, reboot, re-download, and download the videos. Thus far I haven't found any that don't work.
replyContent: Awesome! Glad it's working for you now. Thank you for your support.

content: Dont like that you cant look at the words if you dont have your wireless tuened on. It needs to be fixed
replyContent: You don't need an internet connection. You can download all the videos under Settings for free. Once the videos are downloaded WiFi is not required. Or you can use the app with wifi or 3g/4g to save space on your device. (You Choose) Please let us know if you need help, you can reach tech support the this email  appsavers@gmail.com

content: Love that you can "favorite"  words and make your own quiz. Extrememly helpful.

This is a pretty typical app with a dictionary comparable to other FREE apps. Also, it's a little annoying that you're required to be connected to Wi-Fi to view videos if you haven't downloaded the entire video library onto your phone.
replyContent: There are only two ways to provide you the videos that we know of. Either we need to give you all the videos, or you download them as needed with WiFi. We gave you both of these options and let you choose whats best for you.. We're not sure what other options you are referring to... The app has over 5000 ASL videos, not typical in free apps.

content: I love this app. I downloaded all the videos under Settings and the Play All feature runs through all the videos nice and smooth. The ASL signs are correct and they even provide multiple ways to sign some words in case you are from a part of the country that uses a different sign. Lots of features. Thank you.
